title.narrative: Shelter and NFI Assistance to Affected Populations from Tropical Storm Ana in Malawi

description.narrative: On 26 January 2022, the Government of Malawi (GoM) declared a state of disaster following Tropical Storm Ana, which led to severe flooding across some districts, especially in Southern Malawi. A joint inter-agency assessment team was deployed to the heavily affected districts, which estimates that 112,779 people have been displaced by floods and are living in 122 displacements sites, such as collective centres, across the worst affected districts. A large proportion of the sites identified constitute internally displaced persons (IDP) settlements at collective centres (primarily schools and churches). While sites require basic infrastructure and upgrade assistance, shelter and non-food items (NFIs) are urgently required to reduce protection concerns and ensure basic humanitarian standards, particularly to enable the return of IDPs and decongest the displacement sites and enable recovery. Through this project, IOM is supporting the district authorities while working directly with the 12 largest sites to model and mentor improved identification of the differentiated needs of men, women, boys and girls and vulnerabilities; conducting emergency site improvement projects; and providing shelter and NFI kits to the most vulnerable households that have been affected by Tropical Storm Ana in Chikwawa and Nsanje districts.
